title: Glasses

description:
- Download the RAR file from the Pikapetey Discord

- Open the unity project (do NOT import your shiba model)

- Select the unity scene thats applicable to you (I suggest normal arms, long arms look wonky in game) Import your textures and accessories manually from your own shiba

 -Export the avatar (has .avatar file extension, if avatar exporter is not in Window > avatar exporter, it most likely means you have the vrchat sdk in the project file, see parenthesized text in step 2.)

-Open LIV, install the steamvr driver, and drag your avatar onto the VIVR window

-Go into the camera section of the Liv App, and add a new camera. Make sure the camera type is set to avatar.

-From here on calibration and selection will be done in game. Look down, you'll see the LIV icon, pull the trigger while pointing at it and it will open the menu. Select your avatar and click calibrate on the right side.

-Unlike vrchat, calibration is done by standing on two green shoes marked on the floor. From here you want to t-pose exactly like the image displayed in front of you, your hand and head positioning does matter so make sure to t-pose as close as you can to exact.

-You should be done! You will not be able to discord screenshare as LIV only outputs video, but it works great with fullbody!

Feel free to follow Liv's own tutorial if you happen to get stuck.

See here for more information on the unity side of your beat saber transformation! https://www.vrcarena.com/assets/lWuKBt505XrETlfHEER8

Examples:
https://youtu.be/hSJ8W1tl9Yc
https://youtu.be/5fWIyZApl4Y
https://youtu.be/ngB6fimPHjY
title: LIV/Fullbody Shiba in Beat Saber

description:
YouTube tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Krbl0tLpWvo&feature=youtu.be

Text tutorial:

1. Download the RAR file from the [Pikapetey Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/224293432498061313/595643494618365952/701232020247937035)
2. Open the unity project (do NOT import your shiba model)
3. Select the unity scene thats applicable to you (I suggest normal arms, long arms look wonky in game) Import your textures and accessories manually from your own shiba
4. Export the avatar (has .avatar file extension, if avatar exporter is not in Window > avatar exporter, it most likely means you have the vrchat sdk in the project file, see parenthesized text in step 2.)
5. Download [BSMulti Installer](https://github.com/200Tigersbloxed/BSMulti-Installer/releases) (see ZIP for alternative download) and install Andruuzka's multiplayer client. (The Custom Avatars plugin doesn't seem to work without this, you're not required to play in multiplayer mode.)
6. Place the .avatar file into your steamapps/common/Beat Saber/CustomAvatars directory (create if it doesn't exist)
7. Launch the game and go to Mods -> the far right menu holds all saved avatars. 

Fullbody is available, however it does not work well. See LIV tutorial for more information on better fullbody for Beat Saber and other games

Done!
title: Importing your shiba into Beat Saber

description:
Not for the shiba just a basic lay down animation, may need some editing as it looks too low and **shiba partly glitches into ground**. 

Note: I am using playspace mover to enable the prone animation. You don't have to use playspace mover if you are physically laying down the floor.
title: Laydown Animation
